text: Thomas Arnold Walker (15 April 1952 â€“ 12 May 2022), also known by the nickname of "Boxer", was an English professional rugby league footballer. He played in the 1970s and 1980s. He played at representative level for Great Britain, England and Cumbria, and at club level for Kells A.R.L.F.C., and Cumbrian rivals; Workington Town and Whitehaven. He was born in Whitehaven, Cumbria, England. Walker died on 12 May 2022 from cancer in Cumbria, aged 70. ==References== Category:1952 births Category:2022 deaths Category:English rugby union players Category:Sportspeople from Cumbria Category:Cancer deaths in the United Kingdom
title: Arnold Walker
